top_categories.workout_context: Traka 360’s 224-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Traka 360’s rocky mediterranean gravel, forest trails demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Traka 360 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Traka 360’s rocky mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Traka 360 — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Traka 360 — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on rocky mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Traka 360 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Traka 360 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Every session at Traka 360 intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
At 224 miles, Traka 360 rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Traka 360’s rocky mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack delivers on race day.
Traka 360’s 11,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 224 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 224 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Traka 360. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Traka 360 demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride rocky mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: rocky mediterranean gravel, forest trails, technical descents. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 224 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 224 miles of rocky mediterranean gravel with forest singletrack in Girona, Catalonia, Spain.
